com.mozilla.secops.state

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mozilla.secops.state.State

  • public class State
extends Object
    Represents a generic state interface that can be used to store and load state from or to a persistent storage source

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      State(StateInterface in)
      Construct a new state instance using the specified StateInterface

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteAll()
      Flush all keys in the underlying state storage
      void done()
      Inidicate state object will no longer be used

      Initialize state instance

    • Constructor Detail

      • State

        public State(StateInterface in)
        Construct a new state instance using the specified StateInterface
        Parameters:
        in - StateInterface to use for state storage

    • Method Detail

      • deleteAll

        public void deleteAll()
               throws StateException
        Flush all keys in the underlying state storage
        Throws:
        StateException - StateException

      • newCursor

        public <T> StateCursor<T> newCursor(Class<T> stateClass,
                                    boolean transaction)
                             throws StateException
        Allocate new state cursor for a set of operations

        If the transaction flag is true, the new cursor will be allocated as a transaction. In this case be sure to properly commit the transaction in the cursor when complete.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Class used in state storage
        Parameters:
        stateClass - Class used in stage storage
        transaction - If true, allocate cursor as a transaction
        Returns:
        StateCursor
        Throws:
        StateException - StateException

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws StateException
        Initialize state instance

        The initialize function should be called prior to reading or writing any state using the State object.

        Throws:
        StateException - StateException

      • done

        public void done()
        Inidicate state object will no longer be used

        The done function must be called to ensure any background threads and resources are released.
